result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason F Wright was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jason F Wright was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jason F Wright not in court, Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared by video for Jason F Wright. Status conference to determine sentence credit on the sentence after revocation.  Discussion by parties.  Court ordered 532 days sentence credit on 14CF126.  Notation to be made on judgments of 14CF311 and 15CF14 that sentence credit was used in 14CF126. Adjourned 8:27 AM.
Filed by Atty Wright breakdown of credit.
Filed by Atty Johnson re: additional credit.
Status conference on June 14, 2021 at 08:15 am.

3:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jason F Wright appeared in court in custody, Attorney Erik C. Johnson appeared.  Revocation Summary reviewed;no changes.  Sentencing recommendations.  In 14CF126, court imposed 18 months Initial Confinement, 18 month extended supervision consecutive.  In 14CF311 OWI charge, court imposed 2 years initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision consecutive to other cases.  In Bailjump Charge, court imposed 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision concurrent to OWI.    In 15CF14, court imposed 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision consecutive to any sentence.  3:54pm

records.addlTxt: 11:00 am -11:35 am  Cases heard 14CF311 & 14CF126.  Defendant Jason F Wright in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court imposes on 14CF126: sentence withheld 3 years probation with 1 year jail with huber and good time, 36 month revocation & ignition interlock, $3468.00, AODA & treatment, not poss/consume alcohol, DNA sample and  $250.00 surcharge,  138 days jail credit.  Cash bond applied.  Court imposes in 14CF311: Count 1: sentence withheld 3 years probation concurrent with 1 year jail with huber and good time concurrent, 36 month revocation & ignition interlock, $3468.00, AODA & treatment, not poss/consume alcohol, DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge.  138 days jail credit.  Court imposes on count 2: sentence withheld 3 years probation concurrent, costs of $518.00  Cash bond applied.
Sentencing Hearing 01/12/2016 at 11:00-see 14CF126 for scanned NOH

Defendant Jason F Wright in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 14CF126, 14CF311. Defendant pleads no contest to count 1 in 14CF126.  Defendant pleads no contest  to count 1 and count 2 in 14CF311.  Court will dismiss PAC's in both cases.  Court will adjudge guilty and order a JOC on each case. Bond is revoked.  PSI is ordered to be done within 60 days.
